intro: Rhaphis acicularis, commonly known as the needleleaf rhaphis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by fibrous, woody fruits. Rhaphis acicularis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
